availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, clerk and merchant. Kentucky native. Clerk in Maysville, Kentucky, in 1850. Married to Jennie Taylor Taylor in Mason County on March 1, 1854. Father of Robert N. Taylor, Whiteman F. Taylor, John Taylor, and Charley Taylor. Clerk in Mason County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Mason County in 1850. Merchant in Mason County in 1860. Merchant in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 33B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 3, p. 753, 755.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Mays Lick, p. 58.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville Ward 5, p. 455B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mason County Marriages, 1851-1864, Film #000281844, p. 441 of 444 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Ninth Congressional District, Sub-district 6, KY, October 1863, p. 156 of 175 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
